experiment_a_memory.notes: Git commit messages are unusually detailed (include constraint and decision info inline), narrowing the gap. Telos provides more structured output (behavior specs, intent IDs, explicit constraint lists) but quantitative keyword-based delta is small.

experiment_c_review.notes: Git-only agent noticed inline code comment but dismissed it as informal and APPROVED. Telos agent had authoritative structured constraint data and firmly REJECTED. Critical behavioral difference: approve vs reject.

experiment_e_status.notes: Git-only agent noticed removal but accepted 'flexibility' argument (approve with comments). Telos agent cited recorded constraint and firmly rejected.

experiment_f_leak.notes: Largest gap (2 criteria). Git-only agent recognized potential issue but approved as 'debugging improvement'. Telos agent cited explicit security constraint and rejected.

experiment_g_escalation.notes: Hardest case for Telos advantage. Member->Admin change is blatant enough that even git-only agent rejected. Telos advantage is authority and specificity (citing exact constraint) rather than detection.

summary.details: 6 of 7 experiments passed including critical Experiment C. Only Experiment A failed (delta 5% < 30% threshold) because detailed commit messages narrowed the gap. Telos consistently provided: (1) authoritative constraint citations, (2) stronger rejection recommendations, (3) broader cross-module awareness.
